Hi 👋, I am Hamza

Biomedical Engineering PhD Student 🎓 specializing in Neuro-AI 🤖🧠. I study dynamical biological and artificial systems with a focus on vision and decision-making.

Currently working with Dr. Karim Jerbi at the Cognitive and Computational Neuroscience Lab and affiliated with Mila and the Faculty of Medicine at Université de Montréal.

I am a strong proponent of open science 👨🏻‍💻 and aim to impact the community by focusing on Ethics & EDI 🌍, science accessibility 🔬, and raising awareness about AI’s potential harms ⚠️.

Originally from Sfax, Tunisia 🇹🇳, now based in Tiohtià:ke / Montréal, Canada 🇨🇦. Pronouns: he/him.

Affiliations

This section highlights my current and past affiliations, as well as where I studied and graduated.

Computational & Cognitive Neuroscience Lab (CoCoLab)

Graduate Research Student

I joined the CoCoLab, led by Dr. Jerbi, in 2022, where I conducted research for my master's degree and am currently pursuing my PhD.

MILA - Quebec Artificial Intelligence institute

Student & Researcher

I completed my MSc in AI at Mila from 2022 to 2024, where I took a variety of courses. I am now continuing my journey as a PhD student.

Université de Montréal

Graduate Studies

I completed my graduation internship at UdeM, followed by an MSc in the Computer Science Department/Mila. I am now pursuing a PhD in Biomedical Engineering at the Faculty of Medicine.

Systems Neuroscience and AI Lab

Graduate Research Student

While working on my MSc project, I also joined SNAILab, led by Dr. Bakhtiari.

Higher School of Communication of Tunis

Research Lab

After my pre-engineering studies, I joined SUPCOM, a leading engineering school in Tunisia, where I earned a national degree in Telecommunications Engineering.
